meanings.definition: A type of ancient Greek statue of a young woman
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed a beautiful kore in the Greek art section.
meanings.sent2: The kore stood gracefully in the courtyard, capturing the essence of ancient beauty.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous children pretended the kore statue was their new friend.
meanings.sent4: Her movements were as elegant as a kore come to life.
meanings.sent5: The kore's serene expression seemed to watch over the garden.

meanings.definition: The innermost part of a fruit containing the seeds
meanings.sent1: She carefully removed the kore of the apple before slicing it.
meanings.sent2: The juicy kore of the watermelon burst with flavor in every bite.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that the kore held the secret to the fruit's deliciousness.
meanings.sent4: The kore of the pomegranate resembled a treasure trove of ruby seeds.
meanings.sent5: The ripe peach's kore was a small, hidden gem waiting to be discovered.

meanings.definition: A unit of currency in South Korea
meanings.sent1: He exchanged his dollars for Korean kore to use during his trip.
meanings.sent2: The price was listed in both US dollars and Korean kore at the store.
meanings.sent3: She saved up all her spare change to have extra Korean kore for shopping.
meanings.sent4: The value of the Korean kore fluctuated in the international market.
meanings.sent5: The street vendor happily accepted Korean kore for the tasty snacks.
